snippet: Many medical groups and women's advocates have for years been concerned about what they call a gender gap in health coverage: Although health plans generally cover prescription drugs, most exclude contraceptives, which results in more out-of-pocke...
lead_paragraph: Many medical groups and women's advocates have for years been concerned about what they call a gender gap in health coverage: Although health plans generally cover prescription drugs, most exclude contraceptives, which results in more out-of-pocket expenses for women than for men. But a closely watched effort in California to change coverage plans appears headed for defeat.
abstract: Many medical groups and women's advocates have for years been concerned about what they call gender gap in health coverage: although health plans generally cover prescription drugs, most exclude contraceptives, which results in more out-of-pocket expenses for women than for men; but a closely watched effort in California to change coverage plans appears headed for defeat; Gov Pete Wilson must decide whether to sign legislation requiring health plans that cover prescription drugs to cover many contraceptives as well; Wilson spokesman says that Wilson is leaning strongly toward a veto (M)

headline.main: Effort to Cover Contraception Likely to Fail
